content: As an AI language model, I do not have specific information on the feedback process for film festivals. However, some festivals do offer feedback to filmmakers on why their films were not selected. This feedback may come in the form of written critiques, video or phone calls, or in-person meetings. It depends on the festival's policy and resources, as well as the availability of the selection committee members. The purpose of the feedback is to help the filmmakers learn from their strengths and weaknesses, improve their craft, and enhance their chances of success in future festivals or other venues. However, not all festivals provide feedback, as the process can be time-consuming and subjective, and the selection committees may be overwhelmed with the number of submissions they receive.
